引.definition: to draw (e.g. a bow); to pull; to stretch sth; to extend; to lengthen; to involve or implicate in; to attract; to lead; to guide; to leave; to provide evidence or justification for; old unit of distance equal to 10 丈[zhang4], one-thirtieth of a km or 33.33 meters

引以為傲.definition: to be intensely proud of sth (idiom)

引以為戒.definition: to take sth as a warning (idiom); to draw a lesson from a case where things turned out badly

引以為榮.definition: to regard it as an honor (idiom)

引以為鑑.definition: to take a lesson from (an adverse experience)

引入.definition: to draw into; to pull into; to introduce

引向.definition: to lead to; to draw to; to steer towards

引吭高歌.definition: to sing at the top of one's voice (idiom)

引咎.definition: to take the blame; to accept responsibility (for a mistake)

引導.definition: to guide; to lead (around); to conduct; to boot; introduction; primer

引徵.definition: quotation; citing; to cite; to reference

引戰.definition: (Internet slang) to bait others into an argument

引水.definition: to pilot a ship; to channel water; to draw water (for irrigation)

引水入牆.definition: lit. to lead the water through the wall; to ask for trouble (idiom)

引流.definition: to draw off (liquid); (medicine) to perform a drainage procedure; to attract traffic online

引火.definition: to kindle; to light a fire

引火線.definition: fuse (for explosives); (fig.) proximate cause; the last straw

引燃.definition: to ignite; to start (a fire); (fig.) to spark (debate, conflict etc)

引狗入寨.definition: lit. to lead the dog into the village (idiom); fig. to introduce a potential source of trouble

引狼入室.definition: lit. to show the wolf into the house (idiom); fig. to introduce a potential source of trouble

引玉之磚.definition: lit. a brick thrown to prompt others to produce a jade (idiom); fig. a modest suggestion intended to prompt others to come forward with better ideas

引用.definition: to quote; to cite; to recommend; to appoint; (computing) reference

引申.definition: to extend (the meaning of a word, an analogy etc); derivation

引申義.definition: extended meaning (of an expression); derived sense

引發.definition: to lead to; to trigger; to initiate; to cause; to evoke (emotions)

引經據典.definition: lit. to quote the classics; to quote chapter and verse (idiom)

引線.definition: fuse (for an explosive device); electrical lead; intermediary; catalyst; (dialect) sewing needle

引線穿針.definition: to thread a needle; (fig.) to act as a go-between

引而不發.definition: to pull the bow without shooting (idiom from Mencius); ready and waiting for action; to go through the motions; to practice; a trial run

引薦.definition: to recommend sb; to give a referral

引蛇出洞.definition: lit. to pull a snake from its hole; to expose a malefactor (idiom)

引見.definition: to introduce (sb); (esp.) to present to the emperor

引誘.definition: to coerce (sb into doing sth bad); to lure (into a trap); to seduce

引證.definition: to cite; to quote; to cite as evidence

引起.definition: to give rise to; to lead to; to cause; to arouse

引路.definition: to guide; to show the way

引退.definition: to retire from office; to resign

引逗.definition: to tantalize; to lead on; to tease

引領.definition: to crane one's neck; to await eagerly; to lead; to show the way

引頸.definition: to crane one's neck; (fig.) with one's neck outstretched in expectation

引頸就戮.definition: to extend one's neck in preparation for execution (idiom)

引鬼上門.definition: lit. to invite the devil to one's house (idiom); fig. to introduce a potential source of trouble
